intro: Hoffmannia capillacea, commonly known as the hairy hoffmannia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and dense clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving the plant its common name. It is a flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae and is known for its delicate appearance. Hoffmannia capillacea is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
